headline: Families Huddle in Dark Across a Ravaged Island, Wary of the Aftershocks
abstract: Thousands of Puerto Ricans slept outside, fearing new tremors, after the 6.4-magnitude earthquake that struck the island Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: GUÁNICA, P.R. — On what would have been Jeremy Lugo’s first day of seventh grade after moving back to Puerto Rico from Florida, his middle school collapsed.
